intro: Lepidotosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandplain grass, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, often on sandy or rocky soils. Lepidotosperma species are generally low-growing, with narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in their native habitats.
